result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Scudder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   Cash bond applied. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: 30 days stayed. To be used at the Courts discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Scudder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua J Scudder in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing. Defendant must submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Joshua J Scudder appears by video conference along with attorney Brett E Reetz who appears in person.  Defendant Joshua J Scudder in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates he picked up a shift at work and was working on Monday. State requests cash bond. Defense not objecting to cash bond being set. Cash bond set. Same conditions apply.
Defendant in custody.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Attorney Brett E Reetz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 11:40 am., reviews events in file.   Atty Reetz indicates his office sent several letters to defendant advising of todays court days. Atty Reetz hasn't heard anything from defendant. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Joshua J Scudder in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Defense requests another status, would like time to talk to defendant about the State's offer. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.
from Atty Reetz requesting to reschedule 8/03/15 hearing because of a conflict. Court reschedule hearing from 11:15 to 8:30 am on 8/03/15.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Joshua J Scudder in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 6/2/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 9/16/15)
